clinical_study.brief_title: Unsupervised Elastic Band Exercises Performed by Frail Elderly Hospitalized Patients Monitored by the Bandcizer
clinical_study.official_title: Feasibility Study of Unsupervised Elastic Band Exercises Performed by Frail Elderly Hospitalized Patients Monitored by the Bandcizer as a Supplement to Usual Supervised Physiotherapy Sessions

brief_summary.textblock: This feasibility study investigates if frail elderly and hospitalized patients are able to perform unsupervised elastic band exercises as a supplement to their usual supervised physiotherapy sessions and how much training they perform during their hospitalization. It is also investigated how the frail elderly and the health personnel experiences the unsupervised elastic band exercises.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From inclusion-discharge from hospital - up to 6 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: The total number of repetitions performed
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From inclusion-discharge from hospital - up to 6 weeks

other_outcome.measure: Mean deviation from the prescribed TUT per repetition in seconds during the course of the intervention
other_outcome.time_frame: From inclusion-discharge from hospital - up to 6 weeks
other_outcome.description: The mean deviation is calculated as the difference between actual TUT and prescribed TUT (8 seconds).

other_outcome.measure: Difference in score of two tests: The 30-s chair stand and the de Morton Mobility Index (DEMMI)
other_outcome.time_frame: From beginning of hospitalization to discharge from hospital - up to 6 weeks

arm_group.description: Unsupervised Elastic band exercises performed once a day until the patient is discharged from the hospital. One exercise for the upper extremity (row exercise level 1-3) and one exercise for the lower extremity (knee extension level 1-3). The two exercises are both performed as 3 sets of 10 repetitions.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Frail elderly and hospitalized patients with a minimal score of 5/15 measured by the Tilburg Frailty Indicator
- Able to read and understand Danish
Exclusion Criteria:
- Frail elderly and hospitalized patients with a score of <5 measured by the Short Portable Mental Status Questionnaire
- Frail elderly and hospitalized patients where resistance training and physical activity is contraindicated (evaluated by a geriatrician and/or physiotherapist)
